_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The one freed both ways in a qualified s: A mendicant who is quite secluded from sensual pleasures
Enters and remains in the first absorption
Meditates directly experiencing that dimension in every way
The one freed both ways in a definitive: A mendicant who goes totally beyond the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception
Enters and remains in the cessation of perception and feeling
Meditates directly experiencing that dimension in every way
Their defilements come to an end.
